intro: Hieracium pseudauriculoides, commonly known as the false mouse-ear hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with basal leaves that are broadly heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in clusters, often in late spring to early summer. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
